page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Formerly an area of small{villages, Plymstock, Hooe, Turnchapel and Oreston, concerned mainly with farming and fishing and linked to Plymouth by ferry and railway, during this century it has been engulfed by the growth of Plymouth. The area is now dominated by post war{housing estates,}mainly privately owned, with most people {commuting}to Plymouth by car each day across the Laira Bridge. A semi-rural atmosphere, easy access to the coast and city have made this a popular{residential suburb}which continues to{spread}to the south.A large comprehensive school and shopping precinct were built in the 1960's to serve the{growing {population}but there is very little industry except for{waterfront {sites.}The citadel standing on the Hoe is one of many{tourist attractions.
